radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild left ventricular hypertrophy, mild aortic and tricuspid regurgitation, intraventricular conduction delay, notched QRS in lead III, and early repolarization in some precordial leads.
Scattered foamy macrophages in the portal areas and within sinusoids; accumulated material was PAS positive and diastase resistant.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: After infusion, the amount of Gb3 in the liver sample reduced from 25 nmol/mg of protein to 16 nmol/mg of protein (36% reduction).

radiographic_examinations.findings: Immunocytochemical staining revealed infused a-gal A localized primarily in Kupffer cells and sinusoidal endothelial cells.

radiographic_examinations.date: 24 hours before infusion and at 28 days postinfusion
radiographic_examinations.findings: Pre-infusion sample indicated Gb3 at 1958 nmol/g of creatinine; 28-day postinfusion sample showed Gb3 at 640 nmol/g of creatinine.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: 67% reduction in Gb3 from pre-infusion to 28-day postinfusion sample; no reduction seen in 24-hour or 7-day postinfusion samples.
